title: Austria and Romania basking in heatwave
description:
(3 Aug 2017) As temperatures across Europe soared on Thursday, people tried to beat the heat by going swimming. 
In the Austrian capital, Vienna, the mercury climbed to 38 degrees Celsius. 
To cool down, Austrians headed to inner city swimming pools, such as the "Badeschiff"' (bathing ship) at the banks of the River Danube.
Meanwhile in Romania, meteorologists on Thursday issued a warning about unusually high temperatures, with 42 Celsius forecast for parts of western Romania. 
Locals in the capital, Bucharest, searched for relief from the scorching weather at a nearby lake, despite not being allowed to swim there. 
The heat wave, which began Monday, is expected to last until the middle of next week.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/5201b94c9dc56d450ebaa805ac281c0a 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
